8.17.17  12:48 pm   I was watching the Joy of Painting the other day. I don't know how familiar you are with Bob Ross' videos...

      but his approach to creating art is just unbelievable. And insanely inspiring. In almost every painting he'll say something like "now it's time to make a big decision" then without seemingly even thinking about it he'll just paint a giant fucking tree or mountain or something right in the middle of the foreground, that takes up a huge chunk of the painting, even covering up things he's already painted in the background... and it winds up working beautifully. I know so many artists, writers, musicians etc who are so meticulous and who spend more time thinking about what they're gonna do, then they do actually doing the thing. Like when I'm writing a song... I scrutinize every single phrase.. is that the best rhythm? Should I use a different chord to harmonize this note? Should this be louder or softer, should I use this effect, etc. But if I w ere Bob Ross, I would just throw a big old wrench into the song on a whim, and make it work. ('This is your world, and in your world, notes can live wherever you want them to. Let's put this note here. That's nice. Let's put this chord here'). Do you think that you're able to approach your content in the 'Bob Ross way'?

8.16.17  3:26 pm   i want to be immortal, i want to be remembered. i am so fucking afraid of oblivion, just this fear's size and dimension scares the shit out of me. i want to do something to create a revolution, i want to change the world but it's not enough. i am never enough. i'm gonna lose my mind. i have to do something to leave a mark but i don't know where to start and i am the only obstacle. to be real, to prove i existed, i need to do, just do, but i only dream and waste time and i never "do". i have to start all over again. i have to do something original and perfect but i can never satisfy myself, so i still wait to be ready for the moment i'll finally decide to do. is this relatable for you?

8.16.17  3:10 pm   i don't know what i'm gonna do. there's so much to do, so many dreams, so many goals, so many things to live in this limited life, so many thoughts and i feel like my head is gonna explode and i feel too much. tick tock, time is running out and i just lost another second to begin the change i want to make. i've been waiting my whole life for to start in a cocoon. everything i've learned was for that moment. it has been years but why am i still waiting? why don't i begin? why can't i just do it?

8.16.17  12:44 pm   I've heard different artists/musicians/writers say different things about this... just curious what your thoughts are... Do you have an overarching concept or vision that guides your work? Zappa called this 'conceptual continuity' and it was a huge aspect to his music. I've also noticed this a lot in Prince's music (a lot of songs are self-referential or reference other songs, and there's certain little recurring rhythmic patterns that he uses, and certain ideas, like sexuality and spirituality, get revisited often). Dwayne Thomas Jr., a great bass player, takes it a step further and says that you should write down your own artistic vision and read it daily... So do you have your own, specific vision or 'conceptual continuity'? It doesn't have to be something that is clearly evident to fans, but just something in your own mind that your working towards, or kind of ties everything together for you?
